name: JFrogArtifactoryDeployer
description: This task helps you to deploy generic build result artifacts to Artifactory
author: jfrog
helpMarkDown: Upload artifacts to JFrog Artifactory using JFrog Artifactory cli.

inputs.name: artifactoryEndpointName
inputs.label: Artifactory URL
inputs.helpMarkDown: Artifactory URL to deploy your artifacts JFrogArtifactoryDeployer is run.

inputs.name: overrideCredentials
inputs.label: Override Credentials
inputs.helpMarkDown: Override credentials given in service configuration.

inputs.name: login
inputs.label: User Login
inputs.helpMarkDown: User with permissions to deploy to the selected Artifactory repository

inputs.name: password
inputs.label: User Encrypted Password
inputs.helpMarkDown: Password for the user entered above. Note: It is higly recommended to use an encrypted password so that your password is never passed in clear text to Artifactory.

inputs.name: artifactoryCliPath
inputs.label: Path to JFrog Artifactory Cli exe
inputs.helpMarkDown: Path to the Jfrog Artifactory Cli executable [More Information](https://bintray.com/jfrog/artifactory-cli-go/artifactory-cli-windows-amd64/view)

inputs.name: contents
inputs.label: Path to the Artifacts.
inputs.helpMarkDown: Path to the artifacts to be uploaded.The path can include one or multiple artifacts by using the * wildcard.TFS variables can also be used.

inputs.name: properties
inputs.label: Properties
inputs.helpMarkDown: List of properties in the form of key1=value1;key2=value2;... to be attached to uploaded artifacts.

inputs.name: includeBuildInfo
inputs.label: Enable build information
inputs.helpMarkDown: Enable/Disable build information to be deployed to Artifactory.
